definition: outside (a group etc)/not connected (with an event etc)/external
narrow
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc
outside/in addition/foreign/external
neutralism

sentences.english: You don’t have to be the life of the party, but you can’t be a  wallflower.
sentences.chinese: 你不必是聚会的中心，但是你也不能当局外人。

sentences.english: You have the burden and the great joy of being outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个局外者，你虽然有所背负，但也很快乐。

sentences.english: It is unwise foranoutsider obtrude his opinions into a family quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 局外人硬把自己的想法加入一场家庭争论中是不智的。

sentences.english: During the suspension of play, an outside agency moves the players ball.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛暂停期间，一名局外者移动了球员的球。

sentences.english: I am open to trying new things within reason. I like thinking outside the box.
sentences.chinese: 对于新事物，我勇于接受，喜欢以局外人的身份思考。

sentences.english: On Friday, we saw an 'Outside Day' in a range of over 4.00 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 周五市场出现局外日，市场有超过4美金的交易范围。

sentences.english: So far lots of outsiders have responded by trying to become insiders.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止许多局外人纷纷响应企图成为局内人。

sentences.english: It is unwise for an outsider to obtrude his opinions into a family quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 局外人硬把自己的想法加入一场家庭争论中是不智的。

sentences.english: The name came from the two Davids' shared love of outsider art.
sentences.chinese: 这个名字来自两人对局外人艺术的共同的热爱。

sentences.english: So I learn to be an outsider.
sentences.chinese: 所以我变成了一个局外人。

sentences.english: He took office as an outsider and man of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他以一个局外人和来自人民的代表身份开始任期。

sentences.english: This practice of painting an "outgroup" as homogeneous has a long and dangerous history.
sentences.chinese: 将局外人描述成同类的行径有着深远而危险的历史。

sentences.english: Most supermarket magazines are put together by such outside agencies.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的超级市场杂志由这样的局外出版社进行组配。

sentences.english: Family bonds are closer than those of outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 家庭钮带比局外人更密切地。

sentences.english: You begin to see the societies as both an outsider and an insider.
sentences.chinese: 你开始以局外人和局内人来看待这两个社会。

sentences.english: What does this observer ab extra represent?
sentences.chinese: 这里置身局外的观察人代表了什么？

definition: to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: observer/spectator
the person involved/the people holding power
participant/protagonist/a player (in this affair)
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
state of play in a game of chess/(old) chessboard
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
to feel unconcerned and let matters rest (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 bu4 guan1 ji3 , gao1 gao1 gua4 qi3

definition: chaotic situation
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
